author: bbockelm
body:
We observed that, when CLONE_VFORK is used, gdb sometimes did not
print out the thread associated with the calling process.  As this
is the thread which caused the SEGV in the first place, it made the
sigstack printer less-than-useful.

We were not able to identify why it worked with the CLONE_VFORK in
some cases.

Further, we observed that instances exiting with SEGV/BUS/ILL always
returned exit status 134 (SIGABRT).  This rethrows the signal in
order to get the correct exit status.

(cherry picked from commit 0ad1c49696730150d9115c912de775e6653285e1)

Forward port from 7_4_x
title: Fix sigstack printer.
